newsitem.title: USA: Aviron eyes '99 launch of flu vaccine spray.
newsitem.headline: Aviron eyes '99 launch of flu vaccine spray.

text.p: Aviron aims to launch its nasal spray flu vaccine in 1999, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer J. Leighton Reid said Thursday.

Aviron is currently in Phase III trials of the vaccine in 1,600 children at 10 sites around the country. The study will last through next year's flu season to account for variations in strains of flu and severity of epidemics from year to year.
Reid, who spoke at the Hambrecht and Quist Healthcare Conference here, said Aviron may report interim results before the trials are completed.

Discussing more near-term plans, he said Aviron this year plans to begin Phase I/II trials of the Epstein-Barr virus vaccine it is developing in collaboration with SmithKline Beecham, and plans to file an Investigational New Drug Application (IND) to begin Phase II trials of its croup vaccine.
Also in 1997, the company plans to file an IND on one of its genetically engineered vaccine candidates, Reid said. He did not specify which one.
